nl.uva.se.imppipes.test

Class TimesTwoFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • nl.uva.se.imppipes.Filter<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>
        • nl.uva.se.imppipes.test.TimesTwoFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Runnable

    public class TimesTwoFilter
extends Filter<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>
    Objects of this class are simple Filters, multiplying each Integer they are told to process by two. This Filter is usefull for testing only because the overhead of the filtering processes makes using a Filter an inefficient way of performing a simple task, like multiplying by two, on each element of a List of elements.
    Author:
    FT_7

      • clone

        public TimesTwoFilter clone()
        Description copied from class: Filter
        Returns a Filter of the same type as this Filter, processing input from the same queue and adding the results to the same FilterScaler. N.B. This method can be inconsistent with Object.equals(java.lang.Object) and Object.hashCode().
        Specified by:
        clone in class Filter<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>
        Returns:
        a new TimesTwoFilter processing elements of the same queue and adding the results to the queue of the same FilterScaler as this TimesTwoFilter
        See Also:
        Filter.copyNextAndQueue(Filter, Filter)

      • process

        public java.lang.Integer process(java.lang.Integer input)
        Description copied from class: Filter
        Processes a value. This method defines what this Filter does with each value it gets from it's queue before adding it to the next FilterScaler.
        Specified by:
        process in class Filter<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>
        Parameters:
        input - the Object to process, that is, the Integer to multiply by two
        Returns:
        input*2
